newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - Oct 22.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Economy and Finance Minister N'Goran Niamien says in an interview that a London Club settlement on Ivorian commercial debt is a government priority and will be achieved but says commercial banks must take account of Ivory Coast's long-term ability to pay.
- Court frees on parole 39 opposition activists jailed during political unrest surrounding President Henri Konan Bedie's October 1996 election victory.
- Ivory Coast government announces plan to sell off two sugar complexes including plantations and mills. The complexes are at Ferke and at Borotou and Zenoula, both in the north.

Privatisation Committee announcement advises interested parties to ask for details by November 15 from HSBC Equator Bank in London +44 171 821 87 97 (Tel) or 821 62 21 (Fax) or Ivory Coast's Comite de Privatisation +225 22 22 31 (Tel) or 22 22 35 (Fax)
